page.title: 04Re-opening of Railway ?
page.content: In our weekly local paper this week, July 5th 1985, there is a very interesting item of news.It says, "Government May Help Open Railway." A plan to open a long closed railway line across Dartmoor to Princetown could receive Government support. The scheme-which would mean relaying tracks along the former G.W.R branch-should be in the rural development programme for the area, said Mr Rees of COSIRA,the Council for Small Industries in Rural Areas. He went on to say,"It would be in keeping with the moorland,very attractive and would not spoil the countryside.The railway would enhance the tourist experience of the area. On Monday,July 8th,our class went for a walk along the old railway track to see what it was like.Read our account on the next page.
